meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel very angry or upset.
meanings.sent1: The unfair decision outraged the students.
meanings.sent2: She was outraged by the rude comment.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked outraged when it saw the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The sudden price increase outraged customers.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise from the construction site outraged the neighbors.

meanings.definition: To be extremely offended or shocked by something.
meanings.sent1: The controversial article outraged many readers.
meanings.sent2: He was outraged by the dishonesty of his friend.
meanings.sent3: The dog seemed outraged when it saw a squirrel stealing its bone.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected plot twist in the movie outraged the audience.
meanings.sent5: The false accusations outraged the innocent man.
